title: @Meddler, Regarding Azir
body:
Is the balance team satisfied with Azir as he is?

On behalf of all Azir players, I humbly request a lowered cooldown on max rank Q or a reversion to soldiers' range of 400. Right now he feels a tad bit inconsistent.

replies.body: Current thought is that he's in an okay spot. He's not currently dominating play, but can be extremely effective when played well in an appropriate team comp and lane match up. We would like to help out his early game slightly at some point, in the form of making his last hitting a little easier. We're being cautious about how we do that though, to avoid re-introducing his lane bullying, since that wasn't an intended strength for him and lacked sufficient counterplay for some opponents.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EoP4eoOZ,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-04-28T01:22:44.169+0000)
>
> Current thought is that he's in an okay spot. He's not currently dominating play, but can be extremely effective when played well in an appropriate team comp and lane match up. We would like to help out his early game slightly at some point, in the form of making his last hitting a little easier. We're being cautious about how we do that though, to avoid re-introducing his lane bullying, since that wasn't an intended strength for him and lacked sufficient counterplay for some opponents.

Ever thought of giving him slightly more attack speed per level? Right now he seems more of a champion that either pokes with Q-Auto, or nukes with Q-E-AA-AA. I'd rather have him pushed into more of a sustained fighter than he is right now. Thinking more along the lines of Kayle. He's more related to zyra right now as he has short burst windows.

Sustained damage is definitely the space we want him in. Giving him more base AS, or AS/level, and, if needed, trimming power elsewhere, is something we've talked about, and was the rationale behind the buff to his base AS a few patches ago. Certainly possible we might go a bit further in that direction at some point.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EoP4eoOZ,comment-id=000100020000,timestamp=2015-04-28T05:13:52.377+0000)
>
> Sustained damage is definitely the space we want him in. Giving him more base AS, or AS/level, and, if needed, trimming power elsewhere, is something we've talked about, and was the rationale behind the buff to his base AS a few patches ago. Certainly possible we might go a bit further in that direction at some point.

Currently the build I do (and I believe the meta build) is to grab a stinger after Morellonomicon to hit 35% CDR and get a ton of really nice attack speed.  While this build feels super nice to play, it's also hits an extreme dip in power since you delay your deathcap by 1250 gold as well as your void staff.  

Azir feels acceptably strong immediately after buying his stinger.  The main issue I'm finding is that his power drops off *extremely* hard between building the stinger and finishing the death cap.  That seems to be around the time most frontliners and assassins are finishing up their second item and I simply don't do enough damage to deal with them.

With his limited kill pressure early game and this huge falling off of damage in the midgame, this makes it easy to fall behind on Azir and delay that late game that you picked him for in the first place. **I think if you guys were to change anything, improvements to his midgame would be the #1 approach to take.**  His early game seems fine, especially versus non bully lanes.

If you want my meager suggestion for improving his midgame without messing up the early game or late game, I would say give Azir incentive to skip the stinger so he can go directly into deathcap.  The 10% CDR and attack speed on stinger feel absolutely essential to Azir, but it's a huge expense that delays his strength heavily unless he picks up a lot of kills in teamfights.

This is definitely something I think he needs. I think the ideal place for Azir is one where Nashor's Tooth is no longer a required item because his AS is sufficient without it. There's no point in building the full item, as you really only want the Stinger component. Just sort of wish he'd get more of a boon through his passive so that this item is no longer necessary. It takes up a needless place in your inventory that could be filled with an much more efficient item like Deathcap or Zhonya's.
Would lowering the CD on his E be anything? It wouldn't be too harmful for his lane opponents, since he's getting right up in their face to use it.

> [{quoted}](name=Light24o1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EoP4eoOZ,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-04-28T02:19:27.351+0000)
>
> Would lowering the CD on his E be anything? It wouldn't be too harmful for his lane opponents, since he's getting right up in their face to use it.

Implying Azir players wouldn't just use it to run away more.

Don't know why they even gave him a mobility spell.

> [{quoted}](name=SaltyKracka,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EoP4eoOZ,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2015-04-28T03:17:05.301+0000)
>
> Don't know why they even gave him a mobility spell.

I thought the same thing when I first picked him up. Turns out there are few better things to thwart a towerdive with than a shield and knockup. 

Unless you're saying it's too strong. In which case I'm partially inclined to agree with you, but I think the long CD and the fact that it's blocked by good positioning balances it out.

>I thought the same thing when I first picked him up. Turns out there are few better things to thwart a towerdive with than a shield and knockup.

If you're thinking about it in that way a better way to go might be increasing the CD with a refund when you hit a champ. This would reward using his Q more offensively more than as a run-awy tool.

> [{quoted}](name=LankPants,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EoP4eoOZ,comment-id=00010000000000000000,timestamp=2015-04-28T03:44:10.542+0000)
>
> If you're thinking about it in that way a better way to go might be increasing the CD with a refund when you hit a champ. This would reward using his Q more offensively more than as a run-awy tool.

But that doesn't solve him using it as an escape at all, it just means that when he uses it to engage on someone, he's MORE likely to have it up to use as an escape should he need to in the near future. It's not often that Azir uses his Q twice to escape, so the main result of giving it a reduced cooldown if using it on the enemy is that he can use it to attack the enemy while also being safer should he be engaged on/ganked because the cooldown comes up quicker.

> [{quoted}](name=LankPants,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EoP4eoOZ,comment-id=00010000000000000000,timestamp=2015-04-28T03:44:10.542+0000)
>
> If you're thinking about it in that way a better way to go might be increasing the CD with a refund when you hit a champ. This would reward using his Q more offensively more than as a run-awy tool.

I like this idea. A long cd on the escape (since you only need to escape once) and shorter if you're being aggressive and slamming your squishy body into people.

I played Azir a lot during his free week, and I'm so glad you buffed his base AS. He was unplayable for me on release. However, I feel like he still has [a lot of bugs](http://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/33ii6v/compliation_of_azir_bugs_still_existing/) that needs to be fixed. Soldiers randomly cancelling autos or being used on turret when you don't want them to is super annoying and can cost you kills.  Buffs to his early game last hitting would be welcome though.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EoP4eoOZ,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-04-28T01:22:44.169+0000)
>
> Current thought is that he's in an okay spot. He's not currently dominating play, but can be extremely effective when played well in an appropriate team comp and lane match up. We would like to help out his early game slightly at some point, in the form of making his last hitting a little easier. We're being cautious about how we do that though, to avoid re-introducing his lane bullying, since that wasn't an intended strength for him and lacked sufficient counterplay for some opponents.

Have you though about increasing the speed of his soldier's attack animation? It feels like he has a half second delay between issuing an attack with his soldiers, an his attack landing. (might be an exaduration)

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EoP4eoOZ,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-04-28T01:22:44.169+0000)
>since that wasn't an intended strength for him and lacked sufficient counterplay for some opponents.

honest question, why are some champions (example: {{champion:429}} ) allowed to lack sufficient counterplay for opponents, and others aren't?
The only thing that needs to be worked on are the several known bugs.

Azir feels pretty good at the moment.  He could use a few more bug-fixes and if he's still rough, all he really needs is an easier time last hitting during the laning phase.  This'd allow him to better transition into his power as the game progresses if the player chooses to play passively and farm.
I'd say don't touch his damage but make his early game a little less impossible. Maybe mana reduction or cooldown reduction on Q

An Azir got a pentakill in one of my games only about a week ago.

I was impressed, he's not *that* underpowered.
